replies.body: Thanks for not only sharing this great artwork, but for also crediting the artist. {{sticker:sg-ahri-2}}
Not like there's a watermark in the image or anything.
Crediting the artist is always important e-e...

Not only is crediting the artist super important (+1 for a link to their other artwork as well) but it shows the integrity of the OP. There's too many people who copy&paste with "idk who the original artist is" or outright claim it as their own. A watermark is nothing against a bit of Photoshop.

If the original artist is pursuing a career (or even hobby) in art it's important for them to get the proper recognition they deserve for something they probably spent hours or days on.
imo, if I ever got good enough at art for people to share it, I wouldn't care. As long as they didn't claim it on their own.

Well its not about your non-existent art, its about respecting someones artwork and giving credit where its due. Its not like its hard to say and link who the credit goes to. {{sticker:slayer-jinx-wink}}
I still don't see why it's so important. Like, I've seen people rage about it.

I like this because it depicts Ahri's beauty, and her seductiveness is very subtle. You can see aspects of curiosity in her face. It's not just another "huge-breasts huge-butt" drawing. Props to the artist, they did a fantastic job.

What?! Is this a piece of Ahri Fan-art that depicts her in clothing ACTUALLY MADE OF CLOTH?
And not just a body suit made to look like one?!! NANI!?

Guideline rule of the forum 

"DO NOT post fan art, fan-fiction, concepts, or roleplaying discussions"

I like it but it's against the rules

Probably an outdated rule. The other day I saw someone post some fanart and credit the artist and a Rioter came on the thread and said something along the lines of "wow great art, it's also nice to link the artists page" and the proceeded to link it.

> [{quoted}](name=WorksAtAGayBar,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=mlGjk5bs,comment-id=00030000,timestamp=2017-10-15T23:36:59.458+0000)
>
> Probably an outdated rule. The other day I saw someone post some fanart and credit the artist and a Rioter came on the thread and said something along the lines of "wow great art, it's also nice to link the artists page" and the proceeded to link it.

There are outdated rules? Or maybe only sometimes enforced?

Or maybe.....

{{sticker:sg-lux-2}}
Nah I think Segius is right. From the looks of it, fan art goes in Concepts & Creations. Story, Art, & Sound is meant to be for official art. :P
